titleStmt.title: The booke o[f] merrie riddles Together with proper questions, and witty prouerbs,to make pleasant pastime. No lesse vsefull then behoouefull, for any young man or childe, to knowe whether he be quick-witted or no.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by J. Beale?] for Roger Iackson, and are to bee sold at his shop neere Fleet-street Conduit,

notesStmt.note: The first leaf contains a woodcut and a poem; title page A2r.
Identified as STC 3323a on UMI microfilm reel 645.
Imperfect; leaves B4 and C8 lacking; some leaves mended, affecting text.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
